metadata.title: CVE-2019-3820 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
It was discovered that the gnome-shell lock screen since version 3.15.91did not properly restrict all contextual actions. An attacker with physicalaccess to a locked workstation could invoke certain keyboard shortcuts, andpotentially other actions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3820` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnome-shell - 3.28.3+git20190124-0ubuntu18.04.2
gnome-shell-common - 3.28.3+git20190124-0ubuntu18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnome-shell package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.28.3+git20190124-0ubuntu18.04.2').
